plan: To maximize profit, I'll use a mixed strategy approach. Initially, I'll bid slightly below my value to gauge opponents' behavior. If values are high (above $75), I'll bid aggressively, close to my value, to secure wins. For medium values ($40-$75), I'll bid conservatively, slightly below value, to avoid overpaying. For low values, I'll bid minimally to gather data on opponents' bids. I'll adjust based on observed patterns, increasing bids if opponents consistently bid lower than expected. By varying strategies, I aim to identify optimal bidding ranges and adapt dynamically to maximize long-term profit.

Begin with moderate bids slightly below your value to gather data on competitors' strategies. As rounds progress, adjust bids based on observed patterns. Test aggressive bids when your value is high to potentially secure wins and maximize profit. Occasionally, bid slightly above the average of previous winning bids to explore competitors' reactions. In low-value rounds, bid conservatively or not at all to minimize losses. Prioritize learning from each round to refine strategies, balancing between aggressive and conservative approaches based on current standings and competitors' tendencies.

In the initial rounds, I'll test a range of bids slightly below my value to gather data on Andy's and Betty's bidding patterns. I'll occasionally bid aggressively, above my value, to test their reactions and identify any consistent strategies they use. Mid-game, I'll adjust by increasing bids when my value is high, aiming to win while minimizing costs. In later rounds, I'll refine my strategy based on observed patterns, balancing between aggressive and conservative bids to maximize profit. I'll focus on exploiting any predictable behaviors from the other bidders to gain an advantage.

Test a strategy of bidding closer to my value. For values above $50, bid aggressively near value. For values $25-$50, bid slightly below value. For values below $25, bid minimally. Adjust based on opponents’ bids to identify patterns and maximize profit. Prioritize adaptability and data-driven decisions.

In low-value rounds, bid minimally to conserve profit. Observe competitors' patterns for strategic adjustments. Balance risk and reward to maximize long-term profit.
